title:
Submatrices with the best-bounded inverses: Studying $\mathds{R}^{n
  \times 2}$ and $\mathds{C}^{n \times 2}$
abstract:
In both real and complex cases, we establish the connection of the problem
about $2$-dimensional linear subspaces the most deviating from the coordinate
ones with one simply formulated optimization problem for isoperimetric polygons
in Euclidean spaces.
  This study thereby provides a new geometrical point of view on the
$2$-dimensional case of the problem formulated by Goreinov, Tyrtyshnikov and
Zamarashkin \cite{GTZ1997}, and at the same time presents a new application of
the results by Hausmann and Knutson \cite{HK1997}.
